name: boxed::Box::<T, A>::pin_in
doc: Constructs a new `Pin>`. If `T` does not implement [`Unpin`], then `x` will be pinned in memory and unable to be moved. Constructing and pinning of the `Box` can also be done in two steps: `Box::pin_in(x, alloc)` does the same as [Box::into_pin]\([Box::new_in]\(x, alloc)). Consider using [`into_pin`](Box::into_pin) if you already have a `Box`, or if you want to construct a (pinned) `Box` in a different way than with [`Box::new_in`].
